original_text:
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
**INSTITUTION
**PLACE , PA **ZIP - CODE
**NAME[AAA , BBB]
**ID-NUM
**ID-NUM
A4B/442
SERVICE OF :
**NAME[ZZZ YYY] JR **NAME[XXX]
DATE OF ADMISSION :
**DATE[Sep 09 2007]
DATE OF DISCHARGE :
**DATE[Sep 14 2007]
PROVISIONAL DIAGNOSIS :
Left knee osteoarthritis .
SECONDARY DIAGNOSES :
Hypertension , history of PE , myasthenia gravis , GERD , constipation , asthma , and obesity .
OPERATIONS AND NONSURGICAL PROCEDURES :
Left total knee arthroplasty by Dr. **NAME[XXX] .
CONSULTS :
**NAME[UUU TTT] , D.O.
BRIEF HISTORY :
The patient is a **AGE[in 60s]- year - old male who has had a longstanding history of osteoarthritis in his left knee .
He has failed to respond to conservative treatments such as NSAID s and corticosteroid injections .
The patient 's arthritis has been progressive and interfering with his ADLs .
So , he has elected to undergo the surgery and the remainder of the history and physical is per admission without any changes or deletions .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
The patient was admitted and underwent the above procedure , had a spinal anesthetic and a regional block .
There were no complications .
He was sent to the recovery room in stable condition .
On postoperative day 1 , the patient complained of some knee pain .
Otherwise , comfortable .
Dressing is clean and dry .
Calf intact .
Calves were soft and nontender .
Neurovascular is intact .
LABS :
Stable .
The patient is doing well .
We will have him out of bed with PT / OT and weightbearing as tolerated and DVT prophylaxis .
We will discontinue the PCA and discontinue the Foley .
Per day 2 , the patient is comfortable and afebrile .
Complains of some constipation .
The wounds are clean and dry .
No erythema .
Calves are soft and nontender .
Neurovascular is intact .
The patient is doing well .
We will continue with current therapy and Coumadin .
Throughout the remainder of the hospital course , the patient continued to do well .
The wound remained clean and dry .
Calves were soft and nontender .
Neurovascular was intact .
By postoperative day 4 , he was flexing his knee to 60 degrees and ambulating approximately 120 feet .
He was straight leg raising and bending his knee to 80 degrees by day 5 .
This patient was discharged to home with the following instructions .
MEDICATIONS :
1. Coumadin 5 mg 1 p.o. daily or as directed .
2. Lovenox 30 mg subcutaneously q.12 h. for a week .
3. Vicodin 1 or 2 p.o. q.4 h. p.r.n. for pain .
4. Imuran 25 mg 1 p.o. daily and 50 mg 1 p.o. b.i.d.
5. Nexium 40 mg 1 p.o. daily .
6. Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg 1 p.o. daily .
7. Ferrous sulfate 325 mg p.o. b.i.d.
GENERAL INSTRUCTIONS :
The patient is to weight bear as tolerated .
We will watch him for signs of infections such as increased redness , warmth , drainage , any foul odor from the incision , any calf pain or tenderness .
Contact the office .
Otherwise will follow up with Dr. **NAME[SSS] in the office in approximately 2 weeks .
DICTATED BY :
**NAME[RRR QQQ] , PA-C
___________________
**NAME[ZZZ M. XXX] , PPP]. , M.D.
Dict :
**DATE[Sep 26 2007] 12:34:24
Tran :
**DATE[Sep 26 2007] 15:33:52
FPH/as/363180/**ID-NUM/**ID-NUM
R :
**DATE[Sep 26 2007] 15:33:52/as
**CARBON-COPY
